notes: 8. Operative Note: A combined anterior and posterior approach with surgical intervention was utilized to address the severe bone pain associated with osteomyelitis of the vertebrae. The patient received general anesthesia with intravenous fentanyl (150 mcg) and sevoflurane inhalation. An anterior thoracotomy was performed for surgical debridement of necrotic bone and abscess evacuation. Posteriorly, a midline incision was made, and laminectomy was performed to expose the affected levels. Thorough irrigation with antibiotic solution was performed. Additional surgical intervention included the placement of an anterior interbody cage, posterior pedicle screw fixation, and bone grafting for stabilization. The patient's vitals remained stable throughout the procedure.
